title: Olga Tokarczuk and Peter Handke, 2018 and 2019 Nobel Laureates in literature, are both mavericks — for wildly different reasons
text:
The simultaneous awarding of two Nobel Prizes in Literature today – to the Polish novelist Olga Tokarczuk (laureate for 2018) and the Austrian novelist and playwright Peter Handke (2019) – shows that it ultimately did the Nobel committee little harm to be shaken up last year by the sexual assault scandal that forced it to defer awarding the 2018 prize. Having reformed its membership and brought in a new selection panel, it has bounced back with a double helping of laureates.

Both are mavericks, even renegades, though for wildly opposite reasons. Olga Tokarczuk’s sharpened feminist sensibility and impulse to narrative mischief, in novels like Flights (2007) and her recent Drive Your Plow Over...
